website_summaries.verdict: Sense is a reasonable option if you want to view whole-home energy output in real-time, but its ability to detect individual appliances is hit or miss.
pros: It's easy to view your home's energy consumption using the $299 Sense Home Energy Monitor's Android or iPhone app
cons: You need an electrician to install Sense
Sense detects devices on its own schedule -- you don't have much control over how and when it identifies new products

customer_reviews.title: ZERO support so hope it works without any problems.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe over time I will increase but for now 1 star is over valuing it. Here are my reasons. First there is ZERO phone support, even for setup problems. I have even emailed (week ago) and they have not responded. Usage is total usage and when you look at devices so far it just lumps everything as other. I know what some of the these devices are but it won't let me assign them myself. Long story short, there are options that are cheaper and I don't see how it is possible that they would work worse and support also couldn't be worse.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I waited about 7 months to give this review.
customer_reviews.text: I waited about 7 months to give this review. The unit isn't accurate detecting separate devices. Nice to see the total usage though. Example as not detecting correctly, my electric baseboard heater is sometimes listed as "water heater 2" this happens often with most devices!! Its nice to see what your HW usage is, but is it worth $300 when electric companies are starting to roll out this same feature with the smart meters? I don't think it is.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I returned it as it looked to be used.  I then purchased directly from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.text: I like the sense monitor very much. However, the one I purchased from Amazon appeared to have been used. The box was so old, that the boxes' orange color was worn off, like it had been slid around on a shelf for a very on long time. The contents was not in any kind of plastic wrap and the items were not wired tied...as I said...used. Perhaps not installed. Perhaps used as a demonstrator, but decidedly not new. I returned it and purchased a new Sense monitor directly from the manufacturer. The product is great and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money. Offline 24 out of 15 days I had it.
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectation for this product. Installation was easy. App interface looked beautiful. But the device keep on going offline. Technical support blamed my mesh network. I have Ubiquiti home wifi setup. I tried everything from static IP to Mac address to a specific access point. But the sense device cannot maintain a connection for more than 12 hours or so. In the 15 days that I kept the device, it went offline 24 times and I had to power cycle in all those instances. It is not acceptable for a product that is this pricey. Don't waste your money unless they update the product.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Total junk. Missed the return window by two days. This device does not work well at all, the only thing it is good at is showing your total energy usage. This device will not detect the majority of your loads. I am using almost 40, 000 watts in my household continuously, yet the sense monitor just groups up everything into other or always on.
customer_reviews.author: Chris&Tukky

customer_reviews.title: Does it work? Who knows Can't get connected to Iphone/ipad. No CS Phone line
customer_reviews.text: Well, so far have spent almost 2/3 of price of device on electricians.. First to come and install. Iphone app would not discover, ipad app would not discover.. Email customer service only, they needed serial number, so had electrician come back and open box so I could get serial number from device.. (Sense advises homeowner not to open up circuit box themselves) Sent to Sense this morning no reply.. Sent notification via website, generic reply, sent notification to FB messenger, was told to send email. Hmm.. Hopefully, they can resolve this and then I will get to pay the electrician again to open circuit box.. So far this experience not so good.. Can't even tell if it's accurate..
customer_reviews.author: TrailerGuyBob

customer_reviews.title: Solar outfit function works but it’s hard to understand
customer_reviews.text: Harder to install them they think or they say due to the fact that in my panel I had add breakers and had to get a DWP specialist to come over and shut off the power by removing the meter, then it took about almost 3 weeks for it to learn some of the stuff and I left messages for Tec to call me back they did call me back but it took a long time for them to get back to me they answered my questions and I’m still learning and trying to understand all the Different functions of it, it doesn’t allow you to label some of the functions but it’s better than having nothing
customer_reviews.author: Barry Koven

customer_reviews.title: Really Wanted To Like It
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like Sense. But after having it installed for a month, I am returning it. It is fairly easy to install and it does provide remote monitoring of the electrical system in general. It really cannot identify very many appliances. In the end, the idea is great but execution is very poor. It is not even a BETA level product at this point. If they survive until they figure out their math, it may become a useful device. The old computer adage, garbage in, garbage out.
customer_reviews.author: taswell

customer_reviews.title: Understand your energy usage like never before
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful device. It works exactly as advertised and you will become happier and happier with it over time. I gave it three stars for installation because of something that isn’t their fault, the design of my electrical panel required the utility company to unlock the main meterIn order for me to access the main feeds. I also have a solar hook up that was very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: RMK

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great concept if it were to work correctly. Takes forever to sense appliances. Confuses items for others. The first item it sensed was my sump pump. I was impressed until I saw that when my stove was on it was reading that my sump pump was on. Then after some time when the stove was off it started alarming me that my sump pump was not working when clearly it was. Way too buggy for the cost. I honestly can’t see spending 300.00 for something still in the testing phase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as promised
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to install and hook up to WiFi. It can show the general power usage for the home. That is where the positive stopped. It has not been able to I’d more then a couple appliances. I’m not asking for naming the brand, just simple separation into a-b-c. It just created a blob of other and put all things into it. It did not work as promised- wish I could get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Martin

customer_reviews.title: Warning: does not work with solar houses
customer_reviews.text: The device and packaging are attractive and installation was trouble-free. But am I a fool? After install, Sense mailed me to say that "they detected a problem" and the device does not work if you have a PV array. That requires a different device, which they also sell. I thought the PV upgrade was optional, and I still don't see where they make clear that it is not. (We monitor our PV production by other means.) It seems I must pay an electrician three times: install it, take it out, put in the new one. Maybe I will do it after I have cooled down, but I am mad enough to consider other alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Oz Wizard

customer_reviews.title: cool gadget jury is still out on it if is worht being an early adopter
customer_reviews.text: I purchases this almost 6 months ago it is still learning and finding new things it helped me find my big energy hogs and keep track of my water pump and sub pump down side it still hasn't found my furnaces or 2 of the stove burners the things it finds is kinda random to me I use a bath fan every day for 4 months 67watts cant find but the instant pot I used 4 times found it one week later it works with hue light bulbs spotlessly but not other smart bulbs like Globe I have linked it to my Alexa, hue and 2 tplink outlets ....i have 9 other smart devices cant find....yet ?
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wanted to like this. But I don’t. It finds lots of devices but it really has no idea what each one is. I get messages saying “this item resembles a pump, but we aren’t sure”. That’s not really helpful. You can see in the app when you turn something but you can’t, let’s say, turn on your dishwasher and then identify it on the app. It just doesn’t work like that. But it takes a solid month for Sense to really find devices and by that time it’s too late to return to Amazon. Really the only thing I find it useful is to monitor my overall power usage. Sorry Sense, I really wanted to like you.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Useless if you have electrical devices other than the simple fridge/oven/heater/lamp
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to try and understand why my electric bill is so high. I have been running the Sense for more than 7 months now, and it's only picked up the main appliances. Fridge, lamp, oven, heater. This is only accounting for about 30% of the total consumption. There is still a large "always on" consumption but Sense is unable to say what it is. So basically it's a good tool to see how much you are consuming TOTAL in real-time, but if you want detailed report per electrical device, this is not the right product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Weak WiFi. Poor multiple Sense support
customer_reviews.text: WiFi antenna weak/small enough that the WiFi access point has to be pretty close I have 2 Sense devices. But the software/app only supports one. So either I have to log in each time or have 2 iOS devices. And there’s no way to combine the information from the 2 separate accounts to have comprehensive home data. It also takes a ridiculously long time for the Sense to "sense" home power use devices. I have had both installed for over 6 months and they STILL haven't figured out over half of my power using devices. Furthermore, there's no straightforward way of helping it learn devices.
customer_reviews.author: don delwood

customer_reviews.title: informative but far from perfect
customer_reviews.text: It actually "finds" many devices but not ALL and it takes a certain level of knowledge and time to properly assign your devices if sense mis-assigned them. Sense also asks you for both model and serial #"s of all your devices you want assigned, and it assigned my new hot tub as 3 devices along with a few other assignment errors. I suppose this is a complex issue because of the 2 pump system with one 2-speed pump and a stepped 1500 watt heater although It also has a merge feature to solve this issue.
customer_reviews.author: gmano050

customer_reviews.title: Every home needs something like this
customer_reviews.text: This found my energy vampires and saved me over $1000 the first year. Doesn’t seem to detect well when appliances aren’t healthy. Also, it’s best to install this at the bottom of the circuit panel. I had to rearrange where it was installed to improve detections. I recommend putting a whole house surge protector at the top of the circuit panel as well to reduce noise coming from the grid. I would get mystery devices showing up and I suspect it was detecting the neighbor’s house that’s connected to the same grid transformer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Remarkably precise, easy to use and helpful.  It is also entertaining as you lower your score.
customer_reviews.text: Sense’s software and displays are clear, intuitive and remarkably precise. The graphs have the intelligence to scale themselves to the screen whether your usage is 3,000 watts or 450. Using its live-as-its-happening graphs gives you immediate feedback in your hands as you turn off lights and anything else. In this way Sense provides an entertaining challenge to you as you seek to lower your wattage score (which also GOOD FOR THE PLANET) and saves you some money. Prepare to buy LED bulbs to replace even your 10 watt mini-nightlight. Sense will display a change of 5 watts or less. Enjoy one of the better pieces of technology that I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Red Fox

customer_reviews.title: A Great Whole-house Energy Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive whole-house energy monitor, but I feel it is worth it if you are strongly interest in where the energy (and dollars) goes. Just having the real-time wattage graph is useful as you walk about switching on an off various lights and appliances. Some interesting things I have discovered: the HVAC is actually running at 15-17 SEER (I suspected it wasn't that efficient), some of my LED ceiling lights pull more power than expected (about 70 watts), and the new washer and refrigerator are amazingly more efficient (about 100-150 watts each when running).
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and neat...
customer_reviews.text: Install went really well however was a bit tight. I feel like an external install should be the default as it seems like it would be safer as many panels won't have adequate space for the device itself. I am a bit disappointed in how well it has identified things however that is partly based on my loads. My refrigerator and geothermal are both variable scroll compressor loads which I would assume to be a challenge. For me I like the monitoring either way though so am happy with it. It would be awesome if we could easily access the raw data as well. Not sure it is worth the price point though.
customer_reviews.author: rhermsen

customer_reviews.title: Great device!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for almost 2 months, it help me cut my electric bill by less than have with all the changes we did. Was using around 1600 Kw per month, now is less than 750Kw per month. My kw rate went down from 23c to 19c . It’s been amazing for me. Totally recommend end this device!
customer_reviews.author: MACR

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, but useless.
customer_reviews.text: The unit was easy to install and set up, but not very useful. I spent about 30 min entering in all my appliances' and utilities' (furnace, water heater, etc) information, which is supposed to help with identification, but it still struggled to find devices, furthermore, when it did finally get one right, I had to enter all the information again. What is the point of entering it at the beginning if it's not going to be used. It lost connection as well and had to reboot and reconnect it. AAnyway, 3 stars for easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: jeenie1928

customer_reviews.title: Also can monitor activity if your sump pump.
customer_reviews.text: Just have to say this is an incredible device. I love knowing what everything in my house is consuming energy wise. The main reason for purchasing was to monitor my sump pump. We had a float fail on a pump years ago and I recently found the float sticking again which cause the pump to over heat a blow a seal. After installing Sense I was able to quickly configure the app to alert me when the pump wasn’t running its normal on off cycles. In my opinion sump pump monitoring is worth the price of the device and everything else is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Cut your bill in half like we did with the Sense
customer_reviews.text: This is one amazing tool for homeowners. We installed solar and over the next 3 years we found that our bills were creeping up. I bought sense to prove to my wife that the utility's net meter was too blame. Sense showed me that we were drawing excessive power and I was able to go around the house and identify lots of phantom draw. One by one I turned off unneeded devices and cut our bill in half. Then the reports and identifying loads started happening and added immense value. Overall the best investment you can make!
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: This thing is wicked smart. It pays for itself..
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was sceptical. I thought it was a gimmick that it would identify devices using only amp draw reading. On the first few days I thought my dear was confirmed when it hadn't discovered anything. But over the last month it's found over 20 devices. It's even identifyed the difference between the AC compressor and fan. It's helped us brop our power bill from $350 to $102! It's already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Farm with multiple panels
customer_reviews.text: Put thus on main panel of our farm just a week ago. Picked up a lot of my devices already. We have 10 refrigerators and freezers, hot tub, multiple split unit heaters, EV charging station, electric fence, heated animal waterers, intelligent toilet, diesel engine block heater, 5 buildings each with sub panel, deep well pump, 2 water heaters, hot tub, two uv bacteria killers, multiple lighting systems, five routers and 7 TVs, gteenhouse plus more, so it will take some time for it to sort things out. So far it is great.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Only useful for detected devices
customer_reviews.text: They recently removed the graph of power usage from the app so now it's basically useless since the features that set this apart from other meters only work once devices have been "detected". After a year, it "detected" 30 devices, but 20 of those are never shown to be on again so there are really only 10 devices it recognizes. A few weeks/months after detecting a device, the "device" in the app won't show as being on even though the physical device is on. I think most of my devices are duplicates of devices previously found that it no longer "sees", although I have no idea what many of them are.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L

customer_reviews.title: New Technology
customer_reviews.text: This is fun and interesting new technology. It’s not perfect but you can help the system learn as it learns your home’s electrical loads. The system “listens” to your electricity flow and tries to recognize individual appliances based on their electrical signature. When it does, it gives you details on when, how often and how much electricity the appliance uses. There is also an active user group along with a responsive company to help work out issues. If you are technically minded and an early adopter Sense may be right for you.
customer_reviews.author: Energy Guy

customer_reviews.title: Everything is a “Fan”
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this and held off for about a year before pulling the trigger. I honestly see no benefit of having it. I have a lot of electronics and appliances in my home and it has turned into a full time job trying to guess what Sense is guessing what each item is. It took a few days and guessed the microwave correctly and I thought it was amazing. Everything since then is not even close. It thinks everything is a fan. Save your money and wait a bit longer until something smarter comes out. Not impressed in the slightest for what they charge for it. If it was on sale for $50 I would pass.
customer_reviews.author: restin

customer_reviews.title: It's just a decent current measurement tool. Not more.
customer_reviews.text: Aside from being a decent gross current measurement device I can't see the value. After 2 weeks it has yet to detect a single device in my house reliably. Of the ones it has discovered it is never accurate and often confuses one load for another or just misses detection all together. Hard for me to recommend this over some of the cheaper solutions out there that don't try to detect distinct devices.
customer_reviews.author: Superpanda

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what it manages to do
customer_reviews.text: Gonna have to return this. I didnt pay 260 dollars to see my electric usage and this thing hasnt detected anything in a week. I got emporia vue as well and just using that along with its expansion meters i get better results. Its one third the price of this sense equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Erhan

customer_reviews.title: Its getting close
customer_reviews.text: This would have been five stars but it is seemingly taking longer than I expected to 'learn' all of our household appliances. There are still a lot of 'always on' and 'other' devices showing up. I like it though as it is very accurate for what it has detected, and the app is easy to navigate. If you have some electrical experience, it is an easy install. It took longer to take the panel cover off and screw it back on than it did to wire up and power feeds and clip the rings onto the inbound wires.
customer_reviews.author: rdub

customer_reviews.title: I was really excited about this and learned a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this and learned a lot about my energy usage. The only thing I wish I could do is identify and tag my own devices instead of waiting for this to recognize it and take a guess at the device type/name. You can always ID and rename a device once it's recognized, but I would prefer instant gratification by turning on an appliance one at a time and naming it.
customer_reviews.author: Drew H.

customer_reviews.title: Good at the basics and gradually improving.
customer_reviews.text: Sense does most of what it says it does. Particularly good is the real-time monitoring of overall home power use. This single area chart makes it easy to get an idea of what different items in your house use for power by watching spikes up and down as you flip items on and off. Buy it for this, everything else is just a bonus. Appliance detection is hit and miss, really useful when it's working but not something I would count on. The app shows continuous improvement so I trust it'll get better.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary R. Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said it takes time to recognize devices in your home. The sense monitor can help you learn how much various appliances effect your power bill. However it's not a device that works perfectly giving you answers without effort on your part. I find it fun and rewarding as I verify the accuracy of appliance detection. A little electrical knowledge will certainly help. For example a fridge has a compressor, fan, defrost coil and a light bulb. These may be recognized as separate appliances in the app. Even with some mistakes in identifying appliances, I'm loving my sense monitor.
customer_reviews.author: jrKemp

customer_reviews.title: Best decision we did for energy saving
customer_reviews.text: It started to detect the devices at home and we realized the water heater wasn't using power as much as we thought. So we cancelled the idea of getting a solar water heater for $2000+, which could pay itself back in 65 years.
customer_reviews.author: David Duman

customer_reviews.title: This is an expensive toy
customer_reviews.text: 1. There is no way you can extract the data in table format or something you can email to your tenants. List of devices, when used, and how long, etc. 2. Not as good in recognizing devices. 3, Too many devices not recognized in Always On or Other. 4. I cannot manually add a device even though I can trigger electric use by turning on and off. 5. This is an expensive toy. Not really worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ip

customer_reviews.title: I. Love. This. Thing!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, works like a top! Detects some devices reliably, others need a little help. That’s fine with me, it’s like being a power detective. The mobile app is awesome and the web app is good too. Great community and company support. Measurements on the app are instantaneous. I could go on and on. If you want to put CTs on each branch circuit (a perfectly reasonable thing if that’s what you want to do) then this isn’t for you, but if you just want the simplicity of just monitoring the mains and gleaning what can be from that, you can’t go wrong with Sense.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money - It doesn't find devices accurately or in a timely manner
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews carefully - there are installations exceeding 2 years and it still doesn't properly identify devices. After 2 weeks it only found an unknown motor. Most smart meters will tell you live kWh readings for FREE. This company has been around long enough that it should recognize more devices but I don't think it ever will. the tv ads and youtube videos will make this little box seem magical however don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Great device to track energy use!!
customer_reviews.text: Great device to track your energy use by the second on your phone from anywhere!! If you want that!! Easy to install in minutes, if comfortable around a electric panel. Takes a few days, but can identify some things on its on, but will need you to run around to test it identified them correctly. Shows tons of data and is a quick and easy monitor. I wish it had the option to sort the category others or to individually identify devices on your own. It tries to give options when it finds a device, but if not it groups into other category, so time will tell, but happy with what I am seeing so far!!
customer_reviews.author: tkgibson

customer_reviews.title: Find the Energy Vampires
customer_reviews.text: Great for finding energy vampires. There are obvious things we know use a lot of power, central ac for example. However this helped me track down several energy suckers. For example, I found out we had a coffee pot that was supposed to be on "auto-off". It was malfunctioning and staying on for 16 hours a day...to the trash with it. Installed it in about an hour, you need an open spot for a double breaker and access to your incoming lines at the top of your box.
customer_reviews.author: Frightwing

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Incompleteness
customer_reviews.text: Pretty Cool idea. Has flaws. Easy to install. WiFi took a couple trys due to strength. Took a week to give me a couple bubbles. After 3 weeks I have not seen any new bubbles. Got AC, Fridge 1,2,3; Microwave, always on,other. That’s it. No tv’s, lights, inside or out(steady draw every night,)no ceiling/attic fans,garage door openers, etc. Very cool idea but not really worth the incompleteness. I’m gonna return it before it’s too late. Can’t wait and loose out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essential addition to your smarthome
customer_reviews.text: Installation was straightforward. I watched some videos to make sure I was comfortable working in the panel. The device tracks total energy consumption immediately, then starts to identify major appliances and systems. It can be configured to provide alerts when known devices start and finish, telling me that my washing machine has finished, or that the garage door has been opened. As expected it's been very helpful for power management, identifying big energy drains and checking efficiency.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Reliability and identification issues
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and use. It helped me identified a few devices but wasn't able to identify my mini split which consumed the most energy. Unfortunately, it died after a little over a month. Amazon is letting me return it regardless (Amazon is awesome!). I am going purchase a different product which is less expensive and compare the difference. I don't want to spend another $300+ for this type of device again...what was I thinking??!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: It just works. The app does everything it should. It also saves me money because I’m finally aware of how much power I’m using. Also, there is no monthly fee which is amazing these days. I really love the notification feature. I have one large incandescent chandelier and I can set it to remind me to turn it off. The feed feature is also great because I can see a history of what was used in my home all day. Hey look somebody just got a drink of water from the refrigerator dispenser...
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Timmins

customer_reviews.title: Great power monitoring decide, somewhat pricy
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for about 2 months. Love the visibility it provides on our power - we know know how much power any device consumes. However, only manually. The device identification process is decent but slow, and have obvious weaknesses such as not being able to identify devices with daily usage while recommending what seems to be ghost devices. Overall very happy with the review, but the identification should improve.
customer_reviews.author: Khanh B. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Smart Meter!
customer_reviews.text: VERY nice tool. I love the quality and support. It took a few months, but it has learned all of my major appliances and A/C - And a couple of small items not yet identified. It has saved us money by diagnosing a faulty ice maker and a poorly performing A/C unit. It also helps us hit our goal for electricity consumption bracket for a huge discount every month! I do wish it had a minimum goal to set as well.
customer_reviews.author: Monica D.

customer_reviews.title: At the mercy of machine learning
customer_reviews.text: Don’t think you can actually “teach” this thing anything. It will detect a spike in usage for sure, and even if you’ve clearly determined it’s appliance “X” you will not be able to identify it as such, nor track it going forward. You are completely at the mercy of Sense’s machine learning. It identified a number of appliance over the first couple months, but in the months since has not identified any...even though i can see a spike when i turn a light on, i can not label it for tracking in the future.
customer_reviews.author: E Folks

customer_reviews.title: Back check power utility company power meter
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery, fast install. Calibration takes a day or more. Still able to see real-time load before calibration is complete. Small CTs that fit into a closed up breaker panel. Software reporting is new to me but looks very powerful. Use cell phone to look at data and reports in real time or over a span of time. The auto load itemized list is a good idea. would like to enter load names manually too. Cannot use pc for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hornbeck D

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible product. I wish it was better at letting me identify sources, and it leaves to much unknown, however it trains you to pay attention as well as spot on for usage and cost. They are to confident in their own algorithm, but highly recommend if you want to watch and lower you electric usage. I’m down at least 25% in usage month vs month of previous year.
customer_reviews.author: justacustomer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but unstable wifi connection
customer_reviews.text: We had a professional electrician install the device. It is simple in design and requires a separate circuit breaker. It took more than 3 months for the device to identify the major appliances in the house. However, the precision is not great. It measures the overall electricity consumption very precisely. That said, the device has a problem maintaining wifi connection. After disconnecting from the wifi, one needs to switch off the circuit breaker for the device to restart and reconnect to the wifi -- a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Valderama

customer_reviews.title: Very easy install
customer_reviews.text: If you like data on electric consumption, this is a neat way to see your usage in real time. My main use for initial purchase was to check on incoming voltage. It doesn't plot that, which would be great for trouble shooting. Also will use for load management during backup generator runs. Even got one for a close friend for Xmas who has 2 Tesla's.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - great support team
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install - less than 1/2 hour. (do watch to make sure the panel cover does not press on the sensor clamps.) Requires wireless networking. No option for wired connection at this time. Automatically detects many things in the house. Should be good for verifying electric usage and billing! Some things seem like they should be detected but aren't (yet). Support is very fast - less than 24 hour turn around for most email / web questions. All in all, really nice product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty useful for monitoring total usage
customer_reviews.text: The device is quite useful for looking at the overall usage in the house. It is not particularly good at identifying devices (even big, predictable ones like electric car). Even when it does identify a device, it is often wrong about whether that device is on or whether it is just something similar. However, the device level data we do get is kind of interesting even if it is not completely accurate. So on the whole, this is not bad.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Murdock IV

customer_reviews.title: Good visibility into power use
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how I will ever get a return on this investment, but it is neat to be able to see how your power is being used over time. As the app matures I’m sure they will figure out how to push alerts based on power deviations, which is where this needs to go if the goal is to drive down power consumption. I like the product though.
customer_reviews.author: N.P.

customer_reviews.title: Very cool device, not sorry I got it at all.
customer_reviews.text: Only did tech support as 3 stars because I’ve never used it, very likely better. Super beat device, led me to watch things closely which led me to save money, added a heat pump style water heater, which took some time to detect but it did, also did the hot water bypass pump and valve which costs some efficiency but now I have instant hot water and overall still far less than my old water heater. In winter that won’t be.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Nocton

customer_reviews.title: It takes time to learn all the devices, but it's definitely worth the wait.
customer_reviews.text: I was especially impressed to hear from customer service at Sense about 2 weeks after the install. They wrote to tell me that one of the current sensors was just slightly open and that was making it hard for the service to correctly identify all the devices in my house. Opened up the breaker box, which is very crowded, and jockeyed things around until I got both clamps fully closed. Customer service got back to me the next day to say the signals were much clearer now. It takes a while for Sense to find everything but it's pretty amazing.
customer_reviews.author: psngray

customer_reviews.title: Poor description
customer_reviews.text: Was not as described. Poor detection on your appliances. Knows my furnace only when the AC is on not just when the fan is running. Never learned the dishwasher, refrigerator. The “Other” devises were more than half of my usage which it never detected. I returned after a month of trying it out
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Parker

customer_reviews.title: It's working and doing it's magic
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use a dedicated breaker for this install. Very easy to install and it was up and running within 30 minutes. I was amazed to learn just how much energy the outdoor Christmas lights are using while on, so I've trimmed back on the run time for those this year. Over time I'm sure this will help identify any unusual energy usage.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: From an certified Electrical Engineer: Do NOT buy this
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this hoax system installed two months now. It had identified three power sources. AC, pump and light. Just to be clear, the pump was misadentified and who knows what a 480w light is Although I had input all the major loads, as of today it still couldn’t identify any other loads. I noticed it has some great feedback and All I can assume is that these are either fake or paid for. In current times, I can honestly gaurentee the public, that there is no algorithm that is so this bad being used in any power recognition system. I think if I would say this is an absolute waste of money I would be exaggerating.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Kleinhans

customer_reviews.title: Finding more than I thought it would based on other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Day 1-7 don't expect much, after that its been finding random devices at its own pace, if you have high expectations to know everything in a week you will be disappointed. If you're patent and have along term goal in mind you'll love this. It's become quite the fun tool for me to find out whats on and name it what it actually is. It's helped us save money by realizing we had a space heater running much more than we wanted. it's probably paid for itself already after 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: mrblan19

customer_reviews.title: Fails to connect to Wifi !!
customer_reviews.text: Wifi signal is weak at best. The app has connection issues. Seems to be getting worse as it tracks more devices. Very disappointed!!!!! I hope they do a firmware update to correct SOON !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul's Books & Stuff...

customer_reviews.title: Sense helps you curb your electrical hunger.
customer_reviews.text: Sense provides you with important insights into your home’s electrical usage. Crowdsourcing helps Sense identify your electrical loads to classify and assign them to the right product (e.g., appliances, lights, etc.). Recommend you get an licensed electrician for installation. After nearly one year of use, it has identified more than 30 electrical loads but will have more difficulty identifying the “always-on” loads. The graphing and dashboarding are top-notch.
customer_reviews.author: David Harrity

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: So far it has detected 19 devices. 5 were detected just yesterday which is 1 month since i have been using it. So i have high hopes that this detection will continue. The sensi certainly has opened my eyes to energy conservation.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Good device good support
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the product for several years now and has done a great job tracking overall usage and with the combination of smart plugs I am monitoring almost all of my usage broken out to either power strip level or even individual devices. For the things to Tech that it does take quite a while so you’ll need to be patient, it’s struggles with multi component devices, and devices with inverter motors and variable speed.
customer_reviews.author: LegoZ

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use, this is the one to have
customer_reviews.text: Could not be more pleased, worked as advertised. I have owned the TED5000 for years and it finally quit and had to be replaced. There is no comparison, Sense is way way better. The TED was like a stone age device, finicky setup, and had terrible software. Did I mention the software was bad? This is the monitor to own, from this century and decade of technology.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Nicolaysen

customer_reviews.title: Great tech support!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this on a Verizon mifi router for a rural install on a subpanel. It has intermittent connectivity issues. Tech support has been great but it still results in gaps in the metering. Hopefully they will fix this... or 5g towers will fix my connectivity issues with Verizon.
customer_reviews.author: Blake H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and instant results!!
customer_reviews.text: We just bought a new home and even though we were hardly there our electric bill was surprisingly high. Could not figure out what was going on. Bought the Sense and installed it in about 30 min. In the next 30 min we had diagnosed it and found 1300w of ghost power loss. Jackpot!!!!! This tool rocks and can’t wait for it now to analyze the rest of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barclay

customer_reviews.title: Should be installed on every power panel.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install if you have had any electrical experience. Started seeing the power meter results right away. Found out something was running several times through the night. It was my well pump kicking on every 10 min. I was able to figure out the problem and stop the constant running. Saving money already. Also, recognized devices are popping every day. Great product. Will at a minimum make you more energy aware.
customer_reviews.author: SC4Bucs

customer_reviews.title: Most important spart tech I have connected to my home in the last 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love to see exactly what uses what energy in the home. I was wowed that since I plugged in my Tesla a year ago this detected the car within a few days and shows the exact watts and dollars $85.00 a year. To charge my car from home. I had trouble getting the solar accessory working at first and tech remotely connected and was able to configure it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Andres and Family

customer_reviews.title: Still learning,
customer_reviews.text: Unit work ok, a little disappointed in the detection of some devices, have had for a while now and still hasn’t identified several large items such as one of our AC units. Our 32” refrigerator, or desktop computers, wish they had a learn feature.
customer_reviews.author: M. Yerkes

customer_reviews.title: Does not provide value.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a fan. For the price, it does not deliver what it promised. My hope was to find and track devices. In my experience, the devices it finds are wildly inaccurate. When it does find devices it’s often mislabeled, and for me, I don’t want to waste my time tracking down which device it actually found to rename it. No manual add feature either and still does not know that my AC runs (draws 10A at 240 full load, had it for over 6 months). Save your money and buy a Shelly power monitor or make your own. Also not UL listed, so be prepared to show your papers for inspections.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money in identifying electrical inefficiency
customer_reviews.text: This is the second sentence monitor I’ve ordered. I have two separate breaker boxes. The software is fascinating to watch as it identifies electrical components in your system. Our primary focus was determining how much electricity our air conditioning unit was using. If you are counting electrical pennies, this is a good dollar to spend.
customer_reviews.author: GranburyAR

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The monitor died after only 2 months. Sense refused to replace it claiming water damage due to possible condensations. Bottom line - device is not sealed and is susceptible to high humidity/condensation etc damage. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: M T

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth it and it works
customer_reviews.text: I am 1 week in. This thing is amazing. It has identified 7 devices in my house. That’s pretty good, but the best attribute is the instant real time data. I can see the usage of one light fixture with Incandescents vs the same fixture with LEDS. Amazing savings! It’s well worth the money. Find a friend that is comfortable going into your breaker box to Install- takes 10mins once the cover is off. Be patient with device detection. I am still waiting for a bunch, but it is very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Soloff

customer_reviews.title: It makes Sense
customer_reviews.text: The unit is performing well. Still not identifying many of my connected items. It appears to have difficulty identifying LED lights. I have several UPS's throughout the house, those are not being identified either. I have been more aware of my usage by monitoring throughout the day. I believe I will end up saving money.
customer_reviews.author: RBTech2

customer_reviews.title: I do like watching it but after 5 weeks it has only ...
customer_reviews.text: Sense has much to lean. It cannot determine the the difference between a humidifier and an air conditioner. Given the the fact it was 16 degrees below zero would make it clear and concise the ac is not running not to mention other erroneous errors. I do like watching it but after 5 weeks it has only found five devices. Thanks, Leo Kirk
customer_reviews.author: Leo Kirk

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy watching
customer_reviews.text: I really bought this to help watch my bill, it's neat to watch in real time and see power some items are drawing and how it impacts you. I have 4-5 batteries on trickle chargers and with this I saw their impact to my power bill. I ended up putting them on a timer to only charge at night when power is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Get a true Sense of your electric usage, per device.
customer_reviews.text: It does 98% of what I want/expected. It takes some time for devices to be recognized. A few happen quickly and then it is a trickle of signal identifications. The info/data I get back is great! Not to mention the ability to set triggers for notifications and/or automation. Edit/Update: I fixed a small typo and to state that Sense has recognized 17 distinct devices in my home.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to you home.
customer_reviews.text: A great tool to monitor your energy usage. Amazing at discovering devices thru the noise of your daily power consumption. Let's you track individual devices and their historic (from installation date) usage over customizable date ranges. You just have to be patient with it. It takes time and multiple uses of many items before they start showing up on the list. I can't wait to see how this grows.
customer_reviews.author: mjheed

customer_reviews.title: scope out high bills
customer_reviews.text: Master electrician that does a lot of trouble shooting electrical problems of all sorts...Really like the set up and constant monitoring both at home and while away... bought for a good customer who is highly motivated to bring cost down on monthly electrical...a good hands on start to real time look at usage....thinking of installing one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Installed easy however didn’t detect my main voltage correctly. Attempted to contact support and apparently they leave for the weekend. I’m fairly good with technology and know when I have a lemon product. Back to amazon this goes
customer_reviews.author: Chuck T

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This product delivers! I did a lot of research and it appears as though it is either going to work well with your home’s electrical system or basically just function as whole home watt meter. In my case, I am pleased with the results after only having it up and running for two weeks. Sense has already found ten devices and has been adding them at a rate of one per day.
customer_reviews.author: PFran

customer_reviews.title: Great product absolutely recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Yes it doesn't quite get what's running and using power and I wish I could just input manually what it is, but I just go around the house and turn things off and on to find out. I'm using 22kwh of power a day and in hopes of cutting that down.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Parker

customer_reviews.title: Takes weeks to learn and really doesn't find everything you have running.
customer_reviews.text: Their instructions were not clear when installing, their terminology doesn't match that of the electrical terminology so it's not clear cut as to what is needed to install. It has been over a month since I purchased and had it up and running and its only detected 6 items. It also constantly says its offline even though the router is very close to it. Needless to say I will be returning it. I wash hoping it would really work and well, but it hasn't.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: 100% Better than the aeon labs zwave meter
customer_reviews.text: 100% Better than the aeon labs zwave meter. the aeon labs kept falling off of my smart things hub(10FT or less away) and would not stream the data tried many times no success. hooked this up and it has worked perfectly with in 3 days had my furnace and my fridge and several lights detected.
customer_reviews.author: chrisc

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool to save money and monitor usage.
customer_reviews.text: I own an EV and so this is like my gas pump gauge. Let’s me know how I’m doing, and also gives me all the info so I can keep my total electric bill down. It’s a great tool for a better understanding of my power usage.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and monitoring
customer_reviews.text: Install took about 30 minutes. Once installed it went to work almost immediately. Finding new devices weekly. Can view voltages on both rails and all current power being used. Very nice tool to monitor power usage especially in the summer
customer_reviews.author: no1warr1or

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool gadget
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. I did it myself but if you're not handy do not attempt to install this yourself. Very satisfying watching/knowing how much energy each device uses. It names and discovers the devices on its own so it's basically a plug and play deal.
customer_reviews.author: Big brother

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: After 30 days of being installed, it's detected most the "thirsty" appliances in my home. It's not as accurate as my other HEM that I have installed, but support is working with me to try and figure out what is going on. So far I am satisfied with the device, and highly recommend it to anyone who wants to know what is going on with their appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Squeaky

customer_reviews.title: Great for energy monitoring
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Sense in October 2018 to track my energy consumption. It has allowed me to change habits to reduce costs including turning off devices with “vampire” power. Install was easy and quick from a licensed electrician. The rating would be higher if device detection was faster. I would still recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: W. Rutnam

customer_reviews.title: Veredicto still out
customer_reviews.text: Veredicto is still out. Had only discovered four devices in two weeks and keeps conflating my dryer, oven and A/C unit. Tech support has been very responsive trying to address the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chilanga

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good given difficulty of problem it’s addressing
customer_reviews.text: Short of putting a tap in every breaker or having only smart devices, Sense has done a really good job of correctly identifying high consumption devices in only a couple weeks (though inexplicably it hasn’t yet singled out my model 3, which is the biggest single consumer and has a blatantly obvious signature). I unfortunately have a lot of devices that if used improperly will waste a lot of power, and I have no doubt sense will pay for itself in the first year.
customer_reviews.author: Moosecat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Monitoring
customer_reviews.text: Our power bill is out of control. We needed to track what could be using so much power. After we installed and as the instructions stated we waited. Its been a couple of weeks and the Sense is still identifying our devices.I am so impressed with the technology. It has accurately identified our appliances and has given us what we needed to turn off power stealing devices.Once we feel that it has identified most everything then we will be setting goals so we can keep our bill under control. I give this device 5 stars for ease of use and ease of installation, We did not need tech support so I cant rate that.
customer_reviews.author: CMNV Steven

customer_reviews.title: Check your electrical panel box first.
customer_reviews.text: After I received the product and finally found an electrician to install the product -- many electricians are hesitant to install the product -- I discovered that -- due to the design of my electrical panel box the product COUND NOT BE INSTALLED. The company PROVIDES NO SUPPORT OR A WAY TO CONTACT THEM REGARDING TO INSTILLATION PROBLEMS such as I experienced. I had to return the products to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey Fowler

customer_reviews.title: I love my Sense!
customer_reviews.text: This works just as well as advertised. It only took me about 20 min to set up since i'm not an electrician and I had to drill a hole for the antenna. Its works in seconds however it takes a few weeks to start detecting individual devices. the UX UI is awesome and the app is easy to use from both the mobile and browser. I connected it to my Alexa for even more fun.
customer_reviews.author: jason bowman

customer_reviews.title: Accurate measurements but detection is gimmicky
customer_reviews.text: It works great as a means to see how much energy total is being used. The whole 'detection' part just doesn't work well to be frank but that's not why I bought it. If you're expecting an itemized list then lower your expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Good idea. Has some bugs
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would help save energy and locate where our energy is being consumed. It takes months to identify what each device is and then you still have to confirm and map them out. Not Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin P Sawejka

customer_reviews.title: Monitor usage and find cost reductions with Sense
customer_reviews.text: Great way to monitor electrical devices in your home - I have replaced all of my traditional bulbs with LED bulbs, but still have some florescent fixtures downstairs - with Sense I can see they use 75 watts - I will slowly replace them with LED fixtures and the savings should pay for the exchange as well as lower my overall wattage for a smaller future generator.
customer_reviews.author: Donald B Woodward Jr

product_meta.title: Sense Energy Monitor – Track Electricity Usage in Real Time and Save Money – Meets Rigorous ETL/Intertek Safety Standards
feature_bullets: SENSE SAVES: Sense saves you energy and money by providing insight into your home's energy use and activity.

SEE WHAT’S UP. KNOW WHAT’S ON: Track how much electricity you’re using, what time your kids got home, or when someone leaves the basement light on. Sense identifies patterns in your energy use to help your family be more efficient, informed, and secure.
MONITOR YOUR HOME’S ENERGY USE FROM ANYWHERE: Real-time data through our iOS, Android, and web apps.
AVOID DISASTER: Set custom notifications for critical devices, like your sump pump, well pump, or flat iron.
MEETS RIGOROUS SAFETY STANDARDS: Sense’s components and system have been designed and ETL/Intertek certified for installation and operation inside the electrical panel.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,069 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
